availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Sanders A. Crowell (Caldwell co., ky, farmer and 2nd lieut 20th ky inf. )

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. North Carolina native. Married to Sarah Jane Laughlin Crowell in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on April 24, 1845. Father of Louisa Jane Crowell, Sarah Eliza Crowell, Helen Crowell, Benjamin Crowell, Robert Crowell, Julia Crowell, and Rose Crowell. Married to Martha C. Dixon Crowell in Caldwell County on May 2, 1864. Father of Sarah Crowell and William Crowell. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Farmersville in 1860. Served in the 20th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as corporal and second lieutenant from January 6, 1862, to June 27, 1862.

ab.bibl:

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000851644, p. 258.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000546374.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 48.
